intro: Catalpa punctata f. urbanii, commonly known as the urban catalpa, is a cultivar of the catalpa tree native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is often used in ornamental horticulture for its aesthetic appeal and ability to thrive in urban environments. It prefers full sun and well-drained soil, making it adaptable to various garden settings. Its fruit pods, which split open to release seeds, are also a notable feature of this botanical variety.
